articles.author: Temani Afif
articles.description:
What I will be doing here is kind of an experiment to explore tricks that leverage a bug with the way CSS gradients handle sub-pixel rendering to create a static noise effect â€” like you might see on a TV with no signal.
Making Static Noise From a Weird CSS Gradient Bug originally published on CSS-Tricks, which is part of the DigitalOcean family. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Making Static Noise From a Weird CSS Gradient Bug

articles.author: Manoj Kumar
articles.description:
So far, weâ€™ve covered how to work with data from an external API in a custom WordPress block. We walked through the process of fetching that data for use on the front end of a WordPress site, and how to â€¦
Creating a Settings UI for a Custom WordPress Block originally published on CSS-Tricks, which is part of the DigitalOcean family. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Creating a Settings UI for a Custom WordPress Block

articles.author: Haley Mills
articles.description:
Hey folks! If youâ€™ve been keeping up with the latest DigitalOcean news, you might be aware that we recently announced our acquisition of a company called Cloudways. In case youâ€™re curious about what this means, we thought it might â€¦
DigitalOcean Welcomes Cloudways to the Family originally published on CSS-Tricks, which is part of the DigitalOcean family. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: DigitalOcean Welcomes Cloudways to the Family

articles.author: Geoff Graham
articles.description:
Iâ€™m often asked where to learn web development. The answer varies, of course, and weâ€™ve published a few posts on the topic over the years, the most recent of which was Chris taking a stab at different learning paths in â€¦
Finding Front-End Development Scholarships originally published on CSS-Tricks, which is part of the DigitalOcean family. You should get the newsletter.

articles.author: Geoff Graham
articles.description:
Is it Fall? Winter? I donâ€™t know, but I woke up with snow in the front yard this morning and felt like it was time to write a little update about whatâ€™s been happening around CSS-Tricks this past month, as â€¦
Behind the CSScenes, November 2022 originally published on CSS-Tricks, which is part of the DigitalOcean family. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Behind the CSScenes, November 2022

articles.author: Saleh Mubashar
articles.description:
In this article we will be diving into the world of scrollbars. I know, it doesnâ€™t sound too glamorous, but trust me, a well-designed page goes hand-in-hand with a matching scrollbar. The old-fashioned chrome scrollbar just doesnâ€™t fit in as â€¦
Classy and Cool Custom CSS Scrollbars: A Showcase originally published on CSS-Tricks, which is part of the DigitalOcean family. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Classy and Cool Custom CSS Scrollbars: A Showcase

articles.author: Temani Afif
articles.description:
After Part 1 and Part 2, I am back with a third article to explore more fancy shapes. Like the previous articles, we are going to combine CSS Grid with clipping and masking to create fancy layouts for image â€¦
CSS Grid and Custom Shapes, Part 3 originally published on CSS-Tricks, which is part of the DigitalOcean family. You should get the newsletter.
